info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:10PM MDT until July 07 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT FOR EASTERN TETON...SOUTHWESTERN CHOUTEAU AND NORTHEASTERN CASCADE COUNTIES... At 610 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Black Eagle to 8 miles west of Highwood to 12 miles east of Belt, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Fort Benton, Belt, Geraldine, Black Eagle, Highwood, Carter, Floweree, Portage, Malmstrom Afb, Tracy, Centerville, Shonkin and Sand Coulee. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms have a history of producing 2 inch diameter hail and funnel clouds.
